title: Zoom automático en página especifica (Automatic zoom on specific page)
content:
Hola, comunidad. Resulta que estoy usando Firefox hace un tiempo, pero desde hace unos días, un sitio en especifico (onlinesoccermanager.com) tiene puesto el zoom automático. Resulta que, de vez en cuando, necesito poner la página en tamaño 90%, pero generalmente me gusta tenerla en 100%. No sé por qué, pero Firefox detectó que quiero que la página esté en todo momento en 90%. Si, puedo ponerlo en 100% con la combinación de teclas, pero solo dura hasta que: o cambio de pestaña, o recargo la página. Por favor, ayuda. Es muy molesto. Me da serios dolores de cuello. Gracias.

Hello, community. It turns out that I have been using Firefox for a while, but for a few days, a specific site (onlinesoccermanager.com) has automatic zoom on. Turns out, every once in a while I need to size the page to 90%, but I generally like to have it 100%. I don't know why, but Firefox detected that I want the page to be at 90% at all times. Yes, I can set it to 100% with the key combination, but it only lasts until I change the tab, or I reload the page. Please help. Is very annoying. It gives me serious neck pain. Thank you.
creator: ValbjörnBjarnason

title: Can't Enable 2FA - BitWarden
content:
Hello,

I am trying to enable 2FA for my firefox account and it is not working.

steps to reproduce 1. Go to https://accounts.firefox.com/settings/clients 2. Click "Enable" next to "Two Step Authentication" 3. Click "Can't Scan Code" 4. Enter value from popup into Bitwarden TOTP field 5. Select "Ready" in popup 6. Enter generated 2FA code from Bitwarden 7. Prompted to copy recovery codes 8. Click "Ready" 9. Enter one of the recovery codes for verification 10. Toast message appears at top of screen indicating success

Expected Result 2FA is enabled

Actual Result 2FA is not enabled and reverts to UI state at step 1.
creator: hmsdavis

title: Videos Still Autoplaying
content:
Hello.

I'm trying to get Firefox to stop autoplaying videos. Under the autoplay settings in Options, I have selected "Block Audio and Video." Didn't work, videos play muted. After searching for a solution, I found a suggestion to try to set the "media.autoplay.allow-muted" to false in about:config. Nothing changed, they're still playing muted.

I'm specifically referring to videos on Facebook and Twitter.

Anyone have a suggestion?

Thanks.
creator: wdvg

title: Help - I can't log in to Weebly
content: Hello - I can't log in to Weebly using my Firefox browser. I used to be able to (very recently!) and I am not aware of changing any settings. I can log in if I am on Safari. A very rude support person on Weebly said there was nothing they could do their end. I don't understand it. I'm not very techie - but I prefer using Firefox. Is it something to do with the latest version? What can I do about it? thanks for your help. Celia

title: How do I configure Firefox to connect to my proxy server using HTTPS, not HTTP?
content:
How do I configure Firefox to connect to my proxy server using HTTPS, not HTTP?

If I enter "tls.example.com" as my HTTP proxy, and 443 as the port number, Firefox sends an unencrypted "CONNECT" header on port 443. Of course, this is wrong, because my proxy server only speaks HTTPS, not HTTP.

If I enter "https://tls.example.com/" as my HTTP proxy, and 443 as the port number, Firefox says "Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site." but in fact, Wireshark confirms that Firefox never even tries to connect to anything! It never sends a single SYN packet at all.

According to: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=378637 Firefox does support the behavior described. That link doesn't explain how to configure it, though.
creator: throwaway17177
